greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n, k) = Number of ways to arrange k indistinguishable points on an n X n square grid so that no four of them are vertices of a square of any orientation.
comment: The triangle is irregularly shaped: 0 <= k <= A240443(n). The first row corresponds to n = 1.
The maximal number of points that can be placed on an n X n square grid so that no four points are vertices of a square is A240443(n).
link: Heinrich Ludwig, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..101
xref: Cf. A240443, A000290 (column 2), A083374 (column 3), A178208 (column 4), A006857 (column 5 divided by 120), A240445 (column 6), A240446 (column 7).
results.author: _Heinrich Ludwig_, May 07 2014
